data.name: Checkbox_BypassFATETargets
data.value: Bypass Only in Combat for FATE Targets

data.name: Checkbox_BypassQuestTargets
data.value: Bypass Only in Combat for Quest Targets

data.name: Checkbox_BypassSelfUse
data.value: Bypass When Combo Suggests Self-Use Action

data.name: Checkbox_DisableInstanceExit
data.value: Disable After Leaving Instanced Content

data.name: Checkbox_EnableAutoRotation
data.value: Enable Auto-Rotation

data.name: Checkbox_EnableInstancedEnter
data.value: Enable Automatically in Instanced Content

data.name: Checkbox_EnforceBestAoETarget
data.value: Enforce Best AoE Target Selection

data.name: Checkbox_OnlyInCombat
data.value: Only in Combat

data.name: Label_DamageSettings
data.value: Damage Settings

data.name: HelpText_AoETargetCount
data.value: Disabling this will turn off AoE DPS features. Otherwise will require the amount of targets required to be in range of an AoE feature's attack to use. This applies to all 3 roles, and for any features that deal AoE damage.

data.name: HelpText_BypassFATETargets
data.value: Disables Auto-Mode outside of combat unless you're synced to a FATE.

data.name: HelpText_BypassQuestTargets
data.value: Disables Auto-Mode outside of combat unless you're within range of a quest target.

data.name: HelpText_BypassSelfUse
data.value: Many jobs have an out of combat action that can be used, for example, {0} or {1}. This will allow these to be used without being in combat.

data.name: HelpText_DPSTargettingMode
data.value: Manual - Leaves all targeting decisions to you. Highest Max - Prioritises enemies with the highest max HP. Lowest Max - Prioritises enemies with the lowest max HP. Highest Current - Prioritises the enemy with the highest current HP. Lowest Current - Prioritises the enemy with the lowest current HP. Tank Target - Prioritises the same target as the first tank in your group. Nearest - Prioritises the closest target to you. Furthest - Prioritises the furthest target from you.

data.name: HelpText_EnforceBestAoETarget
data.value: For all other targeting modes, AoE will target based on highest number of targets hit. In manual mode, it will only do this if you tick this box.

data.name: HelpText_QueueWindow
data.value: This will determine how soon before the GCD is finished to queue up the next weaponskill or spell. Your latency may have an effect on what actions are performed so please adjust this if you're noticing improper action use, i.e double Blizzard IV casts due to MP not updating in time.

data.name: Info_Header
data.value: This is where you can configure the parameters in which Auto-Rotation will operate. Features marked with an 'Auto-Mode' checkbox are able to be used with Auto-Rotation.

data.name: Input_AoETargetCount
data.value: Targets Required for AoE Damage Features

data.name: Input_AutoRotationDelay
data.value: Delay to activate Auto-Rotation once combat starts (seconds)

data.name: Input_QueueWindow
data.value: Queue Window (s)

data.name: Label_DPSTargetingMode
data.value: Targeting Mode

data.name: Label_DPSMaxTargetDistance
data.value: Max Target Distance

data.name: HelpText_DPSMaxTargetDistance
data.value: Max distance all targeting modes (except Manual) will look for a target. Values from 1 to 30 only.

data.name: Label_IgnoreRangeInBoss
data.value: Ignore Max Target Distance In Boss Fights

data.name: HelpText_IgnoreRangeInBoss
data.value: When in boss fights only, any target regardless of distance can be eligible to be attacked.

data.name: Checkbox_FATEPriority
data.value: Prioritise FATE Targets

data.name: Checkbox_QuestPriority
data.value: Prioritise Quest Targets

data.name: Checkbox_PreferNonCombat
data.value: Prioritise Targets Not in Combat

data.name: Checkbox_OnlyAttackInCombat
data.value: Only Attack Targets Already In Combat

data.name: Checkbox_UnTargetAndDisableForPenalty
data.value: Un-Target and Stop Actions for Pyretics

data.name: Checkbox_DPSAlwaysHardTarget
data.value: Always Set Hard Target

data.name: Label_IgnoredNPCs
data.value: Ignored NPCs

data.name: HelpText_UnTargetAndDisableForPenalty
data.value: This will un-set any current target and disable Auto-Rotation actions if there is a current detected Pyretic (or similar, like Acceleration Bomb) mechanic affecting the player, that would harm them if they took any action.

data.name: HelpText_DPSAlwaysHardTarget
data.value: Auto-rotation does not need to target enemies to work, however with this setting enabled it will always set your hard target when it executes an attack.

data.name: HelpText_IgnoredNPCs
data.value: These NPCs will be ignored by Auto-Rotation. Every instance of this NPC will be excluded from automatic targeting (Manual will still work). To remove an NPC from this list, select it and press the Delete button below. To add an NPC to this list, target the NPC and use the command: /wrath ignore

data.name: Button_DeleteFromIgnored
data.value: Delete From Ignored

data.name: Header_HealingSettings
data.value: Healing Settings

data.name: Label_HealingTargetingMode
data.value: Healer Targeting Mode

data.name: HelpText_HealerTargetingMode
data.value: Manual - Will only heal a target if you select them manually. If the target does not meet the healing threshold settings criteria below it will skip healing in favour of DPSing (if also enabled). Highest Current - Prioritises the party member with the highest current HP%. Lowest Current - Prioritises the party member with the lowest current HP%.

data.name: Slider_SingleTargetHPP
data.value: Single Target HP% Threshold

data.name: Slider_SingleTargetRegenHPP
data.value: Single Target HP% Threshold (target has Regen/Aspected Benefic)

data.name: HelpText_SingleTargetRegenHPP
data.value: You typically want to set this lower than the above setting.

data.name: Slider_SingleTargetExcogHPP
data.value: Single Target HP% Threshold (target has Excogitation)

data.name: HelpText_SingleTargetExcogHPP
data.value: You typically want to set this lower than the above setting.

data.name: Slider_AoETargetHPP
data.value: AoE HP% Threshold

data.name: Input_AoEHealTargetCount
data.value: Targets Required for AoE Healing Features

data.name: HelpText_AoEHealTargetCount
data.value: Disabling this will turn off AoE Healing features. Otherwise will require the amount of targets required to be in range of an AoE feature's heal to use.

data.name: Input_HealDelay
data.value: Delay to start healing once above conditions are met (seconds)

data.name: HelpText_HealDelay
data.value: Don't set this too high! 1-2 seconds is normally comfy enough to be considered a natural reaction.

data.name: Checkbox_AutoRez
data.value: Auto-Resurrect

data.name: HelpText_AutoRez
data.value: Will attempt to resurrect dead party members. Applies to {0}, {1}, {2}, {3}, {4}, and {5} {6} {7}

data.name: Checkbox_AutoRezOutOfParty
data.value: Apply to Out of Party Members

data.name: Checkbox_AutoRezRequireSwift
data.value: Require {0}/{1}

data.name: HelpText_AutoRezRequireSwift
data.value: Requires {0} or {1}'s {2} to be available to resurrect a party member, to avoid hard-casting.

data.name: Checkbox_AutoRezDPSJobs
data.value: Apply to {0} & {1}

data.name: HelpText_AutoRezDPSJobs
data.value: When playing as {0} or {1}, also attempt to raise a dead party member. {2} will only resurrect with {3} or {4} active.

data.name: Checkbox_AutoRezDPSJobsHealersOnly
data.value: Only Raise Raisers

data.name: HelpText_AutoRezDPSJobsHealersOnly
data.value: When playing as {0} or {1}, Will only attempt to res Healers and Raisers

data.name: Checkbox_AutoCleanse
data.value: Auto-{0}

data.name: HelpText_AutoCleanse
data.value: Will {0} any cleansable debuffs (Healing takes priority).
